subject: Tracy Smith: An Important CBS News Legacy
body:
CBSNews.com












  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






                                                          
      May 18, 2007 

Hey 
      folks,

Did you know that 
      in Sweden 
      news anchors are called Kronkiters?  Just another nod to the 
      incredible legacy of newsman Walter Cronkite, who retired from the CBS 
      Evening News 26 years ago. And tonight 
      there'll be a special on CBS to honor him: "That's the Way it Is: 
      Celebrating Cronkite at 90."  We had a preview on the show this 
      morning. Some of the biggest names in entertainment and news pay tribute 
      to him, but I'm most looking forward to watching clips of Cronkite 
      himself, especially 
      the enthusiasm he brought to space coverage.  I can watch the 
      first moon landing, with Uncle Walter narrating, over and over again and 
      not get tired of it (and actually, my husband is a space junkie, so in my 
      house, it's required, regular viewing).  
      

This morning, we 
      also wrapped up our series "Just Ask a Woman" with a 
      look at some of the myths of motherhood (no, everyone else is NOT a better 
      mom than you are).  The always funny Mike Myers stopped by to talk about the latest 
      Shrek movie.  And CBS News Sunday Morning's Bill 
      Geist was in the studio, telling Harry all about his new book: "Way Off the 
      Road," which chronicles his travels, trademark wit in tow, 
       to some of the wackier spots in this country. I have so many 
      favorite Geist stories, it's tough to pick one (maybe the cowpie tossing 
      contest?), and I'm excited to revisit them all in this 
      book.

Tomorrow on The Saturday Early 
      Show, I'll be joined by our terrific new national correspondent, 
      Jeff Glor.  We'll help you decide when to give your 
      kids an allowance -- and how 
      much -- plus, we'll offer some tips on the best ways to make up after a 
      fight with your significant other (G-rated, of course). We'll have a PJ 
      fashion show (also G-rated); since it's Jeff's first Saturday show, 
      I'm going to have a little fun with him and tell him he's supposed 
      to dress up in PJ's for the segment. Tune in tomorrow to see if 
      he falls for it ...
And next week on "The Early Show," 
      we'll be featuring a new series, "Happily Ever After." We asked you to 
      share your own love stories 
      with us and out of hundreds of responses we've chosen five couples 
      to highlight on the show.  Our couples have all faced their own 
      unique challenges: dealing with illnesses, accidents, a special needs 
      child ... even one couple that almost didn't get married. Their 
      stories are touching and 
      provide guidance on how we can all have our own “Happily Ever 
      After.”

Tracy  SmithEarlyShow@cbs.com
